result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Joseph Elberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 2 years probation is ordered under Sec. 973.09(2)(a)1.a because the crime was committed while possessing a firearm.

miscConds.notes: Pay according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

No contact with S.L.V. or his family except as approved by Probation & Parole;
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
AMENDED 10-12-2015 to allow defendant to travel outside of the States for employment purposes.

timeConds.notes: Serve 10 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 05-28-2015 @ 8:00 p.m. with huber privileges.

Complete 72 hours of community service to the Hmong community.  Defendant may not hunt until community service hours are completed.  Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council.  
Community Service Completed as verified by Community Service Coordinator as of 09-15-2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Joseph Elberg

records.addlTxt: To amend the JOC
Letter from DOC requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for Count 1.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 72 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 06-05-2015. Complete all hours by 05-05-2016.  Consequences:  no hunting rights reinstated until C/S completed.
Letter from S.L.V. Statement on May 5, 2015 at Sentencing Hearing.
Letter from S/W Dept. of Justice
Letter from Hmong 18 Council of WI Inc.
Letter from Coalition for Community Relations

Defendant Kevin Joseph Elberg in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Tou Vang Sworn.  State informs the court defendant will plead no contest to amended charge of misdemeanor battery 940.19(1) Wis. Stats.  Recommend 2 yrs. probation, 10 days in the PCJ with conditions:  No contact with Mr. Vang or his family.  Atty Loberg confirms agreement and with credit for 2 days served.  Court amends to Misdemeanor Battery advises defendant of charge/max. penalties.  Defendant waives further reading of his rights.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Court acknowleges receipt of statements from S.L.V.; letter from Colation from Community Relations from Woodbury, MN; letter from WI Hmong 18 Council of WI.   Reviewed by counsel.  Pepin County District Attorney assisted by Atty. Roy R. Korte, Wisconsin Department Of Justice.  Victim Statements.  Closing statements from State & Atty Loberg.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation.  Conditions:  10 days in the PCJ with credit for 2 days served.  Report within 30 days and report date to scheduling clerk; additional conditions of probation:  no contact with S.L.V. or his family except as approved by Probation & Parole; Provide DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge & court costs; complete 72 hrs. community service to Hmong community; No hunting until community service completed; huber granted.  Advised of appeal rights.
Status conference at 05-05-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Kevin Joseph Elberg in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Certified Hmong Interpreter appeared in person.  Parties continue with negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Interpreter Kazoua Yang appeared by telephone.  Interpreter Sworn.  Defendant Kevin Joseph Elberg in court with attorney Robert Loberg.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights including the right to a Preliminary Hrg.  State requests $5000 Sign. Bond with condition:  no contact with S.L.V. or his immediate family.  No objection by defense counsel.  Court sets $5000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  No contact with S.L.V. or his family; No possession or consumption of alcohol; No entrance into bars or taverns; No possession of a firearm.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that Lars H. Loberg, Loberg Law Office, has been retained by the defendant, Kevin J. Elberg, in the above-referenced matter.  Demand is hereby made that all correspondence be served upon the undersigned.
